column4: hi - i have a wubi question - a friend has loaded it on her windows7 machine and everytime she goes to update/upgrade the machine freezes up and gives back no status.  i want her to use a tty but nothing happens where you do ctrl-alt-f key.  (A) does anyone have a suggestion what to look out for when update/upgrade barfs off, and (b) how do we get to a tyy console?
anyone here know wubi?
kurogane: man tar
kurogane: owners are by id number, not name, if the owner doesn't have an account the files will belong to a nameless number
anybody answer a WUBI question?
People here don't really like to help out with wubi.  It's usually far more complicated.  A lot of us see the solution to most wubi problems as "just install ubuntu normally" :)
i can appreciate that - i am trying to gently wean my friend off windows :-)
What's the problem?
i have told her to update/upgrade using synaptic.  she tells me the machine freezes up.
Every time?  Does it give any errors?
well, actually it is the package manager automated process and no there are no errors
run it at the cli and see if you can get errors
tell me how to get a tty console?  not an xterm
ctrl + alt + F2
she says that doesn't work - and it doesn't work on my ubuntu either - i get a blank screen
just use a terminal?
applications -> accessories -> terminal
that is an xterm.  i want a tty console not under x
Why?  What's the difference?
because x seems to be crashing
You should have ctrl + alt + F(1-6) as tty's maybe not on wubi though...
sudo caches the password for like 5 minutes or something.
If you wait a while it will ask again. If you log out and log back in it will ask again.
